intro: Podachaenium standleyi, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its velvety, dark green leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a compact shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its flowers, which are usually purple or violet in color, are pollinated by insects such as bees and butterflies. The plant is widely cultivated as an ornamental due to its attractive foliage and long-lasting blooms.
